definition: to combine words/word formation
surname Zu
to form/to organize/group/team/classifier for sets, series, groups of people, batteries
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]

sentences.english: He was pretty strong for his size.
sentences.chinese: 這組詞的共同意思是“相當”。

sentences.english: All your writers do consent that ipse is he.
sentences.chinese: 這組詞的共同意思是“同意”。

sentences.english: There are enough hotels…to suit any pocket.
sentences.chinese: 這組詞都有“足夠的”意思。

sentences.english: Mr. Tomkins…had a wonderful eye for the picturesque.
sentences.chinese: 這組詞都有“極好的”意思。

sentences.english: When an upset was…inevitable, the horses slackened their pace.
sentences.chinese: 這組詞的共同含義是“打翻”。

sentences.english: The keeper made a series of brilliant…saves.
sentences.chinese: 這組詞的共同意思是“貯藏”。

sentences.english: Betty was beginning to pine and to yearn after Beuno.
sentences.chinese: 這組詞的共同意思是“渴望”。

sentences.english: He saw his troops retreat from the field.
sentences.chinese: 這組詞都有“撤退，離開”的意思。

sentences.english: As the spot grew larger, it resolved itself into constituents.
sentences.chinese: 這組詞都可作“成分，要素”解。

definition: sequel/continuation of a book
language component/morpheme/individual characters (making up an expression)
conjunction
lit. draw legs on a snake (idiom); fig. to ruin the effect by adding sth superfluous/to overdo it
lit. to use a dog's tail as a substitute for sable fur (idiom)/fig. a worthless sequel to a masterpiece
lit. a notch on the side of a boat to locate a sword dropped overboard (idiom); fig. an action made pointless by changed circumstances
vivid and colorful (idiom); true to life/lively and realistic
subject
lit. so loud that even the deaf can hear (idiom); rousing even the apathetic
hard to tell if it's real or sham
word formation
clan/race
attributive (modifier)
lit. view a text and interpret (idiom); to interpret word by word without understanding the meaning/a far-fetched interpretation
anecdote/apocryphal story
colloquial (rather than literary) pronunciation of a Chinese character
